descriptionHtml:
[img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/15627-1-1335024235.jpg[/img]

Ever thought mannequins took up too much space in your house?

Ever wanted to display your armors on a shelf that\'s easy to see?

Ever disappointed that vanilla Breezehome didn\'t have enough space for mannequins without a basement addon?

Well then mini-mannequins is for you! 
This mod adds 3 mannequins (for now) to the shelf across the fireplace. It also adds a normal-sized mannequin below the stairs for those who want a slightly bigger one, and because I felt like adding a bonus, I placed an enchanting table in the next room.

[color=magenta]For those of you who want female mannequins, download 
[b]Female Mannequins by Thepal[/b] - http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=9131
This mod is fully compatible with that mod :) [/color]


[size=6][u][b]Version History[/b][/u][/size]
----------------------------
[color=#FF0000][b][u]Version: 1.1[/u][/b][/color]
*Added 3 mannequins in each of the player-purchasable houses in the holds. These include:
[b]Honeyside - Riften
Vlindrel Hall - Markarth
Hjerim - Windhelm
Proudspire Manor - Solitude[/b]
*Refer to the images section to find where they are in the house.

Bugs: None known at the moment

----------------------------
[color=#FF0000][b][u]Version: 1.0[/u][/b][/color]

Bugs: None known at the moment
----------------------------




[b][u]Future development:[/u][/b]
*More mini-mannequins for other player homes in the various holds of Skyrim.
*Many people are requesting that the mannequins are craftable and able to be placed on any surface. After checking similar mods that place things in the world, I found that they use papyrus scripts to get them going. Being my first mod, I have no idea how to use papyrus scripting, and some of the technical difficulties involve the mannequins actually being NPCs and not world objects. If anyone can help give me some tips and tutorials, it would be of great help, and I\'ll give you cookies :D. 
As of typing this I am pouring into papyrus scripts in the CK wiki to get my bearings. I\'ll let you guys know if I figured anything out :)




[b]~ Mods used in the screenshot:[/b]
[b]Female Mannequins by Thepal[/b] - http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=9131
[b]ENB Series Tatsudosi[/b] - http://enbdev.com/index_en.html
author: Derpakiin
